title: Sanforized wordmark
content:
Is anyone able to identify what typeface the Sanforized wordmark is based off of? Futura Condensed Italic has some similarities in feel but it's not quite there. The \_S\_ and \_O\_ seem somewhat unique. Given the era where Sanforization was popular it's possible there are no digital equivalents. Thoughts?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sanforized-type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419112631/http:/typophile.com/files/sanforized-type.jpg) | 26.13 KB |
author: tylor.reimer

comments.content:
I agree that finding all the characters in single typeface is unlikely—very likely a custom bit of typography.

Futura Condensed Oblique, with the substitution of the same typeface’s non-condensed |O|, gets you most of the way.

For the |S|, I'd say the one from this typeface is a close match:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/uomo/condensed-italic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419112631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/uomo/condensed-italic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/uomo/condensed-italic/")
